intro: Nautilocalyx ecuadoranus, commonly known as the Ecuadorian nautilocalyx, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the humid lowland forests of Ecuador, where it thrives in warm and moist environments. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It is often found growing along riverbanks and in shaded understories of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
